default.$description:
Main surface background, one layer above page. Serves as the primary container surface color.

USED IN: Sidepanels, configuration panel, Node Monitor

muted.$description: Muted background, one layer above surface-default. Used for secondary sections or nested containers on main surface. USED IN: Table Column Header, Value Switch bg, Card Array

subtle.$description: Topmost background, one layer above surface-muted. USED IN: –

default.$description:
The base background for the entire app, on which all other surfaces sit on. 
The darkest background color in the dark theme. USED IN: Workflow Canvas

initial.$description: Transparent background for clickable or neutral elements. USED IN: for the initial states of elements with a transparent background e.g Link (initial), Button (transparent), .ValueSwitch-item (initial), TabBar (initial)

hover.$description: Subtle neutral overlay on hover for clickable elements. USED IN: Button Transparent, List Item

active.$description: Stronger neutral overlay for active (pressed) state feedback. USED IN: Button Transparent, List Item

initial.$description: More prominent background for clickable or neutral elements. USED IN: Badge

hover.$description:
Hover background for clickable, more prominent elements.
USED IN: Badge

active.$description:
Active background for clickable, more prominent elements.
USED IN: Badge

initial.$description: Teal background for primary actions or highlights. USED IN:

hover.$description: lighter teal background on hover for primary actions. USED IN: Button (outline and transparent variants), ProgressButton (Outline variant), SplitButton (outline), .TabBar-Item, Toggle, chip

active.$description: lightest teal background on pressed for primary actions. USED IN: Button (outline and transparent variants), ProgressButton (Outline variant), SplitButton (outline), .TabBar-Item, Toggle, chip

initial.$description: Deep Teal background for most prominent, primary actions or highlights. USED IN: Button (filled), ProgressButton (filled), SplitButton

hover.$description: Lighter Teal background on hover for most prominent, primary actions or highlights. USED IN: Button (filled), ProgressButton (filled), SplitButton

active.$description: Significantly lighter teal background on pressed for most prominent, primary actions or highlights. USED IN: Button (filled), ProgressButton (filled), SplitButton

initial.$description: Semi-transparent teal for selectable elements. USED IN: ValueSwitch-item, Chip, Checkbox, RadioButton, TabBar-Item, VerticalMenu-Item

hover.$description: Semi-transparent lighter teal on hover for backgrounds in selectable elements. USED IN: ValueSwitch-item, Chip, Checkbox, RadioButton, TabBar-Item, VerticalMenu-Item, List Item

active.$description: Semi-transparent lightest teal on pressed for backgrounds in selectable elements. USED IN: ValueSwitch-item, Chip, Checkbox, RadioButton, TabBar-Item, VerticalMenu-Item, List Item

initial.$description: Solid Teal background for most prominent, selectable elements. USED IN: RadioButton

hover.$description: Lighter Teal background on hover for most prominent, selectable elements. USED IN: RadioButton

active.$description: Lightest teal background on hover for most prominent, selectable elements. USED IN: RadioButton

initial.$description: Deep red background for error or destructive states. USED IN: Inline Message

hover.$description: Semi-transparent ligher red background on hover for error or destructive states. USED IN: Inline Message

active.$description: Semi-transparent lightest red background on pressed for error or destructive states. USED IN: Inline Message

initial.$description: More prominent red background for error or destructive states. USED IN: Destructive Button

hover.$description: Semi-transparent lighter red on hover for background of most prominent error callouts or destructive buttons. USED IN: Destructive Button

active.$description: Semi-transparent lightest red on pressed for background of most prominent error callouts or destructive buttons. USED IN: Destructive Button

initial.$description: Deep orange background for warning states. USED IN: Inline Message

hover.$description: Lighter orange on hover for background of warning states. USED IN: Inline Message

active.$description: Lightest orange on pressed for background of warning states. USED IN: Inline Message

initial.$description: More prominent orange background for warning states. USED IN:

hover.$description: Lighter orange on hover for background of most prominent warning states. USED IN:

active.$description: Lightest orange on pressed for background of most prominent warning states. USED IN:

initial.$description: Deep green background for success states. USED IN: Inline Message

hover.$description: Lighter green on hover for background of warning states. USED IN: Inline Message

active.$description: Lightest green on pressed for background of success states. USED IN: Inline Message

initial.$description: More prominent green background for success states. USED IN:

hover.$description: Lighter green on hover for background of most prominent success states. USED IN:

active.$description: Lightest green on pressed for background of most prominent sunccess states. USED IN:

initial.$description: Dark blue background for informational messages. USED IN: Inline Message

hover.$description: Lighter blue on hover for background of informational messages. USED IN: Inline Message

active.$description: Lightest blue on pressed for background of informational states. USED IN: Inline Message

initial.$description: More prominent blue background for informational messages. USED IN:

hover.$description: Lighter blue on hover for background of most prominent informational messages. USED IN:

active.$description: Lightest blue on pressed for background of most prominent informational messages. USED IN:

initial.$description: Vibrant brand yellow background for branding elements. USED IN: DesktopHeader-Tab

hover.$description: Lighter yellow on hover for background of branded elements. USED IN: DesktopHeader-Tab

active.$description: Lightest yellow on hover for background of branded elements. USED IN: DesktopHeader-Tab

initial.$description: Neutral background for input elements. USED IN: Checkbox, RadioButton, InputField components

hover.$description: Lighter neutral on hover for background of input elements. USED IN: Checkbox, RadioButton, InputField components

active.$description: Lightest neutral on hover for background of input elements. USED IN: Checkbox, RadioButton, InputField components

default.$description: Semi-transparent neutral overlay for disabled component backgrounds. USED IN: all components with a background in disabled state e.g buttons, checkboxes, input fields etc

neutral.$description: Default text and icon color for dark surfaces.

muted.$description: Muted text color for secondary content

neutral-inverted.$description: Dark neutral text color for use on light surfaces

primary.$description: Teal accent color for text and icons, for use on primary content on light surfaces

primary-inverted.$description: Light teal color for text and icons, for use on primary content on dark surfaces

selected.$description: Subtle teal color for text or icons indicating selection to be used on darker surfaces

selected-inverted.$description: Very light teal color for text or icons indicating selection to be used on dark surfaces

warning.$description: Orange color for warning text and icons, to be used on darker surfaces (e.g warning backgrounds)

warning-inverted.$description: Pale orange color for warning text and icons, to be used on darker surfaces (e.g warning backgrounds)

danger.$description: Red color for danger text and icons, to be used on darker surfaces (e.g danger backgrounds)

danger-inverted.$description: Pale red color for danger text and icons, to be used on darker surfaces (e.g danger backgrounds)

success.$description: Green color for success text and icons, to be used on darker surfaces (e.g success backgrounds)

success-inverted.$description: Pale green color for success text and icons, to be used on darker surfaces (e.g success backgrounds)

disabled.$description: Dimmed neutral color for disabled text and icons

info.$description: Blue color for informational text and icons

neutral.$description:
Default neutral border for components (neutral 25 at 40% opacity).
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

muted.$description:
Muted neutral border for less emphasis (neutral 25 at 20% opacity).
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

subtle.$description:
Subtle neutral border for the faintest components (neutral 25 at 10% opacity).
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

primary-bold.$description:
Primary dark teal border accent for emphasis.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

primary.$description:
Primary light teal border accent for emphasis.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

selected-bold.$description:
Strong teal border indicating selection.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

selected.$description:
Faint teal border indicating selection.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

warning-bold.$description:
Bright orange border for highlighted warnings.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

warning.$description:
Dark orange border for warning elements.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

danger-bold.$description:
Light red border for error elements.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

danger.$description:
Dark red border for error elements.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

success-bold.$description:
Light green border for success elements.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

success.$description:
Dark green border for success elements.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

info-bold.$description:
Light blue border for info elements.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

info.$description:
Dark blue border for info elements.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

disabled.$description:
Neutral gray border for disabled components.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

transparent.$description:
Fully transparent border for components with invisible border.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

brand.$description:
Yellow border accent for brand-related highlights.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

outline.$description:
Blue outline highlight for focused elements.
[Used as reference token only for the Border composite tokens]

default.$description: Dimmed dark overlay background e.g for modals and dialogs (neutral 800 at 80% opacity).
Shimmering gray placeholder gradient for loading content animation.

top.$description: Light shadow layer color for the top elevation USED IN:

middle.$description: Medium shadow layer color for mid-level elevation. USED IN:

bottom.$description: Dark shadow layer color for bottom elevation. USED IN:

0.$description:
No elevation (flat, no shadow).
Animate elevation changes from level 0 to a higher level when an element is highlighted to indicate emphasis and interactivity.

1.$description:
low elevation shadow for slightly raised elements (e.g., cards).

For containers that slightly stand out from the background but are not interactive by default. The elements that are placed inside this are extending the current surrounded context and group them inside the container.

Examples are: Cards, tiles, arrays.

If you use the elevation level 1 on a container, you have to change the surface to be one level higher.

3.$description:
High elevation shadow for elements floating above content (e.g., modals, tooltips).

Used for elements that float above content and who are sitting on top of the ui; but don’t obscure the full context.

Examples are: tooltips, menus or toasts.

If you use the elevation level 3, you have to reset the surface level to page.
